alert.note: Alert for Marathon; Menominee; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 3:31AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WILL WIND DOWN TODAY. HOWEVER OCCASIOANL SNOW SHOWERS AND STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO CREATE CONSIDERABLE BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW. TURNING MUCH COLDER TONIGHT... .A potent winter storm will slowly loosen its grip on the forecast area today. Although the bulk of the accumulating snow has diminished, occasional light snow or snow showers will persist especially over the far northeast and east central portions of the forecast area into the early afternoon. Strong north to northwest winds gusting to 30 to 35 mph will continue to cause considerable blowing and drifting snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow showers. Additional snow accumulations up to an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Marathon, Portage, Waushara, Wood, Menominee, and Waupaca Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on very slippery and hazardous road conditions. Blowing and drifting snow will significantly reduce visibility at times especially in rural areas.
info.instruction: Slow down and use extreme caution if traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Marathon; Menominee; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Wood
